intro: Phtheirotheca, commonly known as the "false snowflake" or "winter snow," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late winter or early spring. Phtheirotheca thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in horticulture.
